lead_paragraph: A New York Times/CBS News poll finds a sharp generational divide within the Democratic Party, with voters under 45 favoring Mr. Sanders.

byline.contributor: Marina Stefan, Megan Thee-Brenan and Giovanni Russonello contributed reporting.
byline.original: By THOMAS KAPLAN and DALIA SUSSMAN

headline.print_headline: Clinton Loses Ground to Sanders in New Poll as Trump’s Lead Holds
headline.main: Hillary Clinton’s Lead Over Bernie Sanders Slipping in New Poll

snippet: A New York Times/CBS News poll finds a sharp generational divide within the Democratic Party, with voters under 45 favoring Mr. Sanders.
abstract: New York Times/CBS News Poll finds Hillary Rodham Clinton's big lead nationally in Democratic primary has mostly faded; 48 percent of primary voters support her, with 41 percent supporting Sen Bernie Sanders; she led Sanders by 20 percent month earlier; Donald J Trump continues to sustain big lead among Republican primary voters.
